website_summaries.verdict: The G700 might be tagged with the gaming label, but we'd be more comfortable using it as a business or productivity mouse. For getting your frag on, there are better options out there.
pros: A good number of buttons to customise
Wireless receiver is tiny and can connect to multiple devices
Free spin and detented scroll wheel
cons: Software looks old and is poorly laid out
Lower thumb buttons aren't that easy to find
Status LEDs don't show the mouse's current settings

customer_reviews.title: Bought at $54, 6 years ago. Price is now $345 as of 2019
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this mouse in April 2013... It is now January 2019 and it's still working great other, than the left button crapping out every now and then. Overall it's been a great mouse for $54.99, but now the cost is $345...? What is going on? I would love to buy this mouse again for $54 but not 345... That's completely insane. Really sucks honestly, it's been a complete fantastic mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Solid but better options...
customer_reviews.text: Back in 2011 I was sold a dream of being able to play wirelessly. Unfortunately this was not the case. The latency was too noticeable to be able to play wireless and so I always kept this one plugged in. It still works but it does not use the logitech unified usb system so it rarely gets used. I have since retired this solid mouse and moved onto SteelSeries mice. I find their shape more comforting and the mouse clicks are more pleasant than the stiffness from the Logitech. I do miss logitech's scroll wheels though. Best in the category.
customer_reviews.author: KTGiang

customer_reviews.title: Developed issues earlier than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this mouse for about 3 years now. I enjoyed it very much for the first year and a half. The adjustable DPI on the fly, for instance, works excellently. However, after the first 18 months: 1) The wireless stopped working and the mouse now must remain wired to the computer 2) The mouse intermittently double clicks when a single click is made 3) The mouse frequently stops dragging and re-clicks in the middle of a drag I did not expect a $100 mouse to lose these key features after 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Mid knowledge Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Overall best mouse I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: Had this mouse since 2012, purchased for $80. Since they're out of production the price has shot up so I wouldn't say it's worth it now. However, this has been the best mouse I've ever used. So comfortable, perfect amount of buttons, and durable. If I could get a brand new one of this I would easily, but I think mine still has at least a couple years left.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: Great but some cons to consider
customer_reviews.text: Cons: -Cable is VERY thick. If you use the mouse with the cable in, it's difficult to play FPS games because it's so darn thick and moves the mouse inadvertently. Very annoying. -Battery life is quite short. Need to charge it every 2 days. There should really be a "casual" browsing mode to conserve power and a "gaming" mode. -I have big hands (can palm a basketball) and for me, it's annoyingly small. Pros: -Gets the job done. High sensitivity makes a worlds difference in gaming. -Great look and feel. -On the fly sensitivity changes using mouse buttons is a nice advantage. -Fast on-the-fly charging. -Interchangeable battery which is cheap to replace. -Driver software is great and well thought-out.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great product, 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts about 1.5 days of continuous use, but it charges pretty quickly via a USB wire connected to a computer. Fits very well, extra mouse buttons took some getting used to, but once you're done with that, it's very nice. Doesn't require any installation to run it immediately, and some settings are built-in already, which apparently can be modified. The scroll release button is a big plus, makes browsing big documents very nice and smooth. Weight is very nice, not the heaviest out there though. It is also one of the biggest mice I've ever used, and shaped very nicely (doesn't fit my hand though, my pinky still stuck out)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extra Most Bestest Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Holy crap. This mouse is flawless. I've had it for, since I bought it and it's been almost 8 years since then. I use it everyday. A true BIFL if one had ever been. I don't know if this review makes sense or gets across what I'm trying to tell you, but if you can get your hands on this mouse, you best be doing it. That's right. Best mouse ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse poor seller
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these G700's since they first came out and my original one is a little run down but I love the mouse so much I decided to purchase another. I got the mouse in what looked to be it's original packaging which isn't and big deal since its used. When I opened up the packaging though I was very disappointed to find a dirty mouse that didn't look like it had been cleaned at all prior to repackaging and selling it. I highly recommend this mouse just would suggest not buying it from IsaacTronics.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming mouse and overall I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite mouse ever! They don't make it anymore but look for the G700s, which is this mouse with longer lasting buttons. Unfortunately the newer model is a little gaudy with "gamer" lines drawn all around it instead of being classy and all black like this model. I would still recommend this mouse if you can find it anywhere, it's served me well over the last few years! I even had to have it replaced due to a faulty left clicker and Logitech sent me a new mouse without having to send in the old one. Having an extra charging cord is pretty handy and their customer service is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew M. Hamling

customer_reviews.title: Feature packed. Just works.
customer_reviews.text: It just works. It does everything it's supposed to. Wireless? check. Wired? check. The software to set all the buttons is really easy and the onboard storage was a brilliant idea so you don't have to set up the software on every computer you use it on. Battery life is pretty decent depending on what power usage setting you do. I have since replaced this mouse with a Razer Naga but still use this for my laptop mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection, Buttons too light, terrible hand feel
customer_reviews.text: I'm always accidentally clicking buttons on this mouse. It's relatively heavy, mostly because of the nickel batteries which don't last very long even when you religiously turn off the mouse when not in use. Awkward is the best way I can put how this mouse feels in the hand. I don't know who wants to hold their thumb like it wants you to, but I just can't hold the mouse crooked like that. The mouse buttons are much too light and the weight of my fingers presses them. A stark contrast from the well weighted keys on the g9x. The mouse frequently has issues with use over more than 4ft distances which is surprising given it's poor battery conservation.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Favorite gaming peripheral of all time!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite gaming peripheral of all time, hands down.... It is so unfortunate I cannot give it 5 stars. I've owned 4 or 5 different g700s. I always keep two in my gaming arsenal at all times. The reason I've had 4 or 5 is because after normal use there always seems to be a breakdown within the first couple years but because logitech is an amazing company they will replace them within their warranty period. I am a huge logitech fan boy because of this. I've owned countless logitech keyboards, speakers, webcams, mice, headsets, and gamepads over the years and will continue to do so as long as they maintain their great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Pack

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mouse for everything!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite mouse ever! I use my PC for both work and play. This mouse allow enough customization that I can preset it for different games and then crank the settings down for work functions. The replaceable batteries can be charges with the included USB cable. Ready to game? Just unplug the mouse it it instantly goes wireless allowing you freedom from the cord. The button placement is perfect and there are just enough buttons to be helpful but not so many that it is cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: paboothz71

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Very easily programmed, feels great. Great material. I thought I scratched it, and just rubbed it the all marks came off- similar material to my weather-sealed EOS 7D. I spent like double my budget on this mouse because my last Logitech mouse is still running like new.. after 4 years. Well worth it, and won't have to be replaced. The battery lasts you long enough for the average day of heavy computing. A very heavy day may require a charge, but the mouse feels just fine when it's wired as well. You can also replace the rechargeable battery if you were on the go as well! I recommend the same brand that provided (Eneloop).
customer_reviews.author: Kush Patel

customer_reviews.title: The USB cable is too stiff
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice mouse, I don't like the software it uses (Microsoft's Mouse and Keyboard Center is much better), but the mouse itself is very nice. The problem is that even at the lowest reporting rate it drains the single battery really fast, so I often need to charge it while using it. Unfortunately, the USB cable (which provides data when plugged in instead of wireless, a nice feature) is very stiff and thick. This means I'm always fighting with it, trying to wrangle it where I want to go. It's such a problem that here I am writing a review about it. I'm currently shopping for a softer, thinner Micro-B USB cable.
customer_reviews.author: Louis W.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice mouse for playing MMOs the extra buttons are helpful ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice mouse for playing MMOs the extra buttons are helpful when you've got loads of skills. Very precise and works on all surfaces, I've been playing on my bed sheets and blankets with this thing, but a little weighty for a mouse. My only complaint with the mouse is that after a while it has begun double clicking with a single click. So sometimes dragging or just clicking something will double click making it very frustrating. The only temporary fix I've found to this is opening the mouse and blowing compressed air into the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron B. Le Beauf

customer_reviews.title: Expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I like the mouse. It works (so far) and I bought many Logitech products in past so I know they do a good job with support (in my experience). I like the software and the easy in changing between settings. I have three sets of button actions. One for general use, and two for different games. If I was going to be critical I'd say that for a "Gaming Mouse" it should have more thumb buttons. Four is "enough" for me but I'd probably prefer 6 or 8. While programmable some of the buttons on top are not easy to use in general but especially if you're holding the main left or right buttons.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Functions great, but battery life is pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: Functions great, but battery life is pretty bad. I purchased an Eneloop AA charger w/ four Eneloop Ni-MH batteries. These are the same batteries that the G700 is factory equipped with.  So, if I keep them charged and rotate out as necessary, I'm ok. If you're afraid your mouse might die in the middle of something important (competition gaming, raids, instances, etc.), you'll want to install a fresh battery beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Benezuela

customer_reviews.title: Not as well built as the G500
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to make this short and sweet. Aside from not being Mac friendly, I loved this mouse. "Loved" being the operative word. After about 6 months it started wearing out. The front button of the 3 on the top left now fires when I left click. Other buttons seem weak too and probably will fail soon. Although it has fewer buttons, the G500 is built much better. I used the G500 for well over a year and it never failed me. G700 = 2 STARS (should be 1, as it is now useless to me, but I'll be nice) G500 = 5+ STARS I'm not even going to waste my time trying the G600 - sorry Logitech..
customer_reviews.author: WHA

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life on this is just absolutely atrocious. Like it dies in a few days versus a few months on every other wireless mouse I have. What's the point of a wireless mouse that you have to plug in constantly? Is its gaming-infused subrendering engine so powerful that it can't live on normal AAs? Who knows. Otherwise it performs approximately like every other mid-grade mouse I've used. It has lots of buttons and moves a cursor around the screen like it's supposed to. As always, I don't recommend installing the Logitech software, which is approximately 230gb in size and will give you cancer.
customer_reviews.author: PNWT

customer_reviews.title: Great Hardware
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech mouse is wonderful. Both my wife and I use it on our gaming desktops. It is textured to give your hands a good grip even after hours of gaming. The hardware feels solid, but not too heavy to the point where it would cause wrist strain. The battery doesn't seem to last as long as my previous gaming mouse, but with the included cable, the mouse can still be used easily even when the battery dies. Furthermore, it has a battery indicator light on the side as well as a low battery warning that will pop up on the monitor. The software is slightly outdated and an update from Logitech would be quite appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this mouse two times now, one at work and one at home. I tried very very hard to find another mouse but couldn't find one with all of the goodies that this has. My real gripe with it is the weight. It's a heavy mouse! Some people may really like this but it mildly annoys me. Aside from the weight issue the mouse kicks major butt in every other category. The battery doesn't last long but that's expected with a gaming caliper wireless mouse. I have 4 hot-swappable charged batteries ready for transfer at any point. I did set the mouse down to economy mode and that really helped out with battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: Osu buckeye 37

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, terrible software
customer_reviews.text: I can say that after my experiences with logitech software and technology lately that unless they have a really huge overhaul that improves everything, I don't think I'll be buying anymore logitech products. Maybe one. Because using multiple logitech products apparently conflicts with each other, which is completely stupid. Setpoint and logitech gaming software will not detect the mouse whatsoever. I can't adjust the buttons for macros then obviously and I can't set the different dpi settings to my liking. The mouse works great as stock, but it's a gaming mouse, it's made to be customizable and I can't customize it.
customer_reviews.author: matt evon

customer_reviews.title: the side buttons feel like they are going to break (and dont click well ...
customer_reviews.text: The top buttons are sticky, the side buttons feel like they are going to break (and dont click well after a few weeks), the cord is extremely stiff (so stiff that i bought a roccat apuri to help).the software interface works well, and is well integrated with my logitech headset and keyboard... only reason this isnt 1 star. 2-3 months after getting this mouse i couldnt stand it anymore, so i bought a redragon perdition. I gave this to a friend who was using a laptop touchpad to play games... hopefully its better.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Worcester

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I slew so many weaklings in online battle while utilizing this very mouse. It's got buttons in great positions for utilizing with the thumb. It's got a great shape to it allowing you to increase your online kill count by as much as 300%.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Girdner

customer_reviews.title: Good Mouse while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Good Mouse while it lasted. Biggest con is that if I read what most wireless mouse and up is the capacitors go bad and it makes it hard to left click and right click or it over left clicks and right clicks so for gaming I would stick with straight wired Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Gee

customer_reviews.title: :-D
customer_reviews.text: Logitech is my go to for assessories. Needed a replacement mouse 'cause I dropped my other one so many times it doesn't work right anymore. And I'm a person who needs a mouse, can't use a laptop without one.This mouse is just simplely awesome. Very comfortable in your hand, and my hands aren't big nor are they tiny. Customization is real cool. software seem straight forward and easy to use. Like the fact that they give you a gaming extender, that's really cool. It's wireless which is what I wanted and has a rechargeable battery, +++ in my book. will b e testing with my games, soon can't wait.
customer_reviews.author: jadedtree

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse because my previous mouse was just too small and it was causing my hand to hurt when playing intensive games like COD-BO2. This mouse has a lot of great features, it feels good in my hand, and performs awesome. The battery life is fairly short so you will need to have the USB cable handy often for recharging. But I just plug it in at night and it is good all day. I have read about others having issues with button not working after a while. I guess we will see. I'll update my review if it stops working for me. I expect a mouse at this price to last at least 3 years or more.
customer_reviews.author: JRH

customer_reviews.title: Get them before they're gone
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and most comfortable mouse Logitech ever made. For some reason it was discontinued many years ago. R.I.P. G700.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Arms

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse, if you don't mind the battery life.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is great, the G700 handles itself like a champ, it takes no time to get used to the ergonomics and it's very responsive with a mostly intuitive software for the extra buttons, if anything the one major con would be the battery life, that after a few months will start to loose charge very quickly, we are talking about 3-5 hrs at most, thankfully it can also work as a wired mouse, overall I would recommend this mouse over most, and I can say that Logitech has earned my trust in the build quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mario T.

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the G700 for about 6 months now. It's been working great. I have been able to complete 6 hour gaming sessions without a problem, and even when the charge gets low I can just plug it into the USB and keep rolling. The USB cord is a bit awkward and stiff, but not so much so that its unusable. My only issue was the pads seemed to wear out way to quick. I just put a code pieces of Teflon tape on the bottom and kept going, works without a hitch now. I have a G930 as well and have had no interference issues between the two running at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M

customer_reviews.title: No More Wireless For Me
customer_reviews.text: Although wireless has benefits, the aggravation using this mouse is not worth it. 1 - The battery life is short. I have to keep my charger plugged into the mouse most of the time which defeats the wireless benefits. The cord is heavy and stiff. 2 - The wireless cuts out and hangs up from time to time. I have to "control-Alt-Delete" and then cancel to get the response to return. It always seems to happen at the worst possible time. The mouse is less than 24" from the chip in the USB port of my computer.
customer_reviews.author: jdssr

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid and good mouse. Lots of button (13 total), configuration and with the new Logitech gaming mouse software can have multiple games presets (set point did that but LGMS its more friendly), high precision 5700dpi max Some cons that it has are that its not using the unifying receiving and it could be kinda elevated for some people. I loved the ergonomic of it. If battery ran out, just plug the usb cord and continue play while charging. By far is the best gaming mouse i ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Abouganem

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I was sad when my G7 mouse died and Logitech had dropped the product. However, I recently found out about this new model and ordered it immediately. It is the G7++! Great weight and feel, all of the controls I want and need, and a rechargeable battery that can be replaced to keep the gaming session going without wires. When my wife's' old MX Revolution died, I recommended this to her and she loves it. I ordered a spare so if one of ours ever gives up the host we won't have to wait for shipping even a day! Logitech hit a home run.
customer_reviews.author: S Wayne Martin

customer_reviews.title: Lightning fast response G keys are nice, can do lots of different functions on any ...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This thing is a tank, after three solid years of use still going strong, and the eneloop battery it comes with still somehow holds a charge. Lightning fast response G keys are nice, can do lots of different functions on any game or application Software nicely designed and easy to use Cons: The charging cable will wear down after heavy use, but micro usb cables are easy to come by so not too much of a hassle. Scroll wheel gets a bit grungy and hard to clean but not impossible
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Would HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Performance is amazing for both Gaming and regular usage -Ergonomics are absolutely perfect for medium to larger hands (cant speak for smaller hands) -Adjustable DPI and Response per Seconds, are both software controlled and allow you to save battery when needed. -Great range. I usually use it about 30 ft away from my receiver. Cons: - None yet even after 1 year of use.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Giron

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and reliable mouse. I have this paired with a Logitech wireless keyboard. I sit about 10 feet away from my computer which is hooked up to my TV, so I can browse the Internet from across the room. I haven't had any issues with wireless feature and the mouse only needs to be charged once a week or so. It has a status light to let you know when it's fully charged. I don't really use it for gaming, but it has some nice features that would make it a great gaming mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wireless G700
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse. I do not game as much as I used to, but sometimes. I switched from the Logitech MX550 mouse and keyboard set because in Windows 7, I was have issues with the mouse. On my XP/Vista dual boot computer, it works fine. The G700 is an excellent product but has a very short battery life compared to the other mouse. I suspect that is because of the higher data transfer rate and other qualities that makes it a great gaming mouse. I keep it plugged in when I am working on my degree, then unplug it to commit massive FPS blood shed!!!!!! This mouse in combination with the Ttesport keyboard is what works for me.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful, simply beautiful. I've gone through many a mouse in my time and none have compared to this one. It is not over done with five hundred thousand buttons your thumb can't keep track of and presses several at once. The four side button design is perfect for most mmo's. It fits my hand perfectly and is comfortable for hours of game play. I've never had any issues with the battery life and I mostly play with it being wireless. And best of all, its a survivor. I have thunked, dropped, thrown, and yes, even once kicked, this mouse and it's still going strong two years later. Logitech G700, you are my hero, I love you.
customer_reviews.author: Pajamas

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming mouse I have every bought. (Also PS4 compatible)
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite gaming mouse I have ever purchased. No batteries, multiple buttons, no gigantic dock, USB charged. After 2 years of heavy gaming, this thing is still running like a champ, and has been shifted from my old desktop, to my laptop, and currently my PS4. The USB plug is designed brilliantly so that it can be plugged in mere seconds, and has saved me many a times when I run the battery dry mid-game. Also, there is no input delay when switching to wireless or back. I hope they never stop making this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W.

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, feels spetacular.  Short battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this mouse, but even with it set to power saver mode, the battery life seems to be low. I ignore the message "10% battery left" and I keep using it until it completely dies. It seems like that message isn't accurate, I get many days more of use, and I get that message after only a few days after changing batteries. I'm using rechargeable (Eneloop XX) so it's not too much of a hassle to switch batteries, but it is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: NATman

customer_reviews.title: no luck for myself
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love Logitech products have the g-15 keyboard and a second back up g-15 just incase it breaks and I cant find one have the g-5 mouse and love it and have the 7 way surround wireless headset. Thought I would love this mouse. No dice. Battery life poor. did not fit my hand at all. This may be just what some are looking for in a mouse but I'll stick with my g-5 mouse and if needed buy 5 of them stick them in a closet to make sure I always have one if this is the alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Allen C. Deckard

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th or 6th Wireless Logitech mouse. It is great in many ways, multiple programmable features that make it nearly ideal for an avid gamer. The only drawback that I have encountered is that the battery life seems less, on short experience, than I have encountered with other mice. It can be overcome as it has the capability for wired use while charging. Unfortunately, I am used to "mousing" without a cord attached so the cord seems extraordinarily intrusive. I would certainly buy the same mouse again so my criticism is, I hope, constructive.
customer_reviews.author: Don Newell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, yet hard to fix.
customer_reviews.text: I Bought this several years ago, and can only say good things about this mouse. There has been some wear in the thumb area, but overall this mouse is accurate, comfortable, fast. I have had to disassemble it once to fix a spring as the two main buttons (left/right click) began sticking. It was a royal pain in the butt to take it apart and put it back together again, as the springs needed to be re-bent back to original shape and reinserted, and this was almost impossible. If you purchase this mouse, expect mouse buttons to fail on it after about 2 years if you game consistently with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse.. Its bulky and pretty big (my first gaming mouse) but I got used to it. I bought it used and it was almost like new, only needed to replace the feet. One big con is the battery life, it doesn't last very long. (hours at the most if you're gaming or heavy using). I have the Logitech g19 keyboard which has 2 USB ports on the right side of the keyboard so i just connect my mouse there to charge while using, I'm just recommending what works great for me. Overall bad ass mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is more of a pain than I'd have thought
customer_reviews.text: OK, so I can make multiple profiles and have several more functions... Aside from the customizable tracking resolution, a decent keyboard can offer you more / better functions than this mouse and even on sale (as it is discontinued at Logitech) it is a waste of money!!!! I have to plug it in EVERY DAY to recharge and I don't use the high gaming performance power option. I alsocan't unplug the USB charging cable while the PC is on without having to restart windows explorer. I usually give credence to the majority of ratings but I really think the ratings mislead me this time! Glad it's discontinued, it will become an expensive paperweight on my desk before long... Really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Dan The Man

customer_reviews.title: a fantastic wireless mouse and a fantastic gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has me spoiled. Now that I have this, I find my thumb looking for the DPI up/down buttons on other mice that I use. The ability to change the mouse's sensitivity on the fly with a single click of a button is immensely useful, especially in games when differing sensitivities can greatly enhance the experience. The battery life is excellent, and I love the fact that I can keep using the mouse while it's plugged in and charging. A great buy. Not once ounce of buyer's remorse.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hawken

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless or wired
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a particularly advanced mouse before. [upgrading from a microsoft 5000 wireless mouse i bought in 2009] All the options to customize were great, but the additional buttons are easy to reach and use. The ability to change the DPI/profile on the spot so multiple people can use the mouse easily is quite awesome. I did buy another one of these prior and it did have an issue but this one has been issue free for over a month. When it works, it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. LACROSS

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Mouse (For gaming or regular use)
customer_reviews.text: What a mouse. There is a lot to say about this, but I'll boil it down here: Pros Wireless. Comes with Eneloop brand batteries (amazing batteries) Rechargeable Small receiver Very comfortable Works on nearly an surface Great DPI settings and switching options Macros! And not an insane amount Cons Honestly, nothing. I found nothing wrong with this mouse until it fell in my apple cider.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for wireless gaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my wife, and she liked it so much I got one for myself. Ergonomically, I wish it were a bit wider (I have long fingers), but it's comfortable. The surface a bit textured, so it's easy to keep a hold of. The battery lasts a long time, but I usually leave it plugged in when I'm surfing the web or doing other mundane things; only going cordless for gaming. There is a bit of a pause when you plug/unplug the cord from it, so don't wait until things are hectic in a game before doing it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Rench

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: I don't have alot that hasn't already been said but there are 2 minor things that I don't like. First off, it has forgotten the keybindings i have set 2 times and it's still the first month of having it. Thankfully, I don't have anything too intricate set up and it only takes me a min or so to reconfig it. Second, the battery doesn't last long at all. If it wasn't rechargeable, I would have went through about 10 batteries in a month. Thankfully it recharges very fast (around an hour and a half from totally dead to full).
customer_reviews.author: H. Hensel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Frequently loses signal, resets profiles, lags, and resets to stock doing settings. Impossible to game with due to this, which is sad because it's otherwise a perfect mouse.
customer_reviews.author: S. Janik

customer_reviews.title: Okay mice.
customer_reviews.text: Used this mice for two years. Pros: Software allows for a lot of customization and profiles for the mice. Multiple thumb buttons for binds, scroll wheel feels nice and solid to use plus the button to unlock the scroll when to free spin is nice. Its wirelessness makes it easy to use since the cord would not hit anything on your desk. and I did not notice any input lag. Cons: Battery needed constant charging with the amount of use I gave it. Charging cord thick and heavy when plugged in. Ergonomics felt forced.
customer_reviews.author: richard t.

customer_reviews.title: An average mouse
customer_reviews.text: Performs well but I wasn't very fond of the particular plastic feel it's made with. Shape is decent but tall. Replaced it with a Cougar 700M that is more adjustable and comfortable for me anyways. Pretty hard to know what you will like without a test drive. Similar to buying glasses or shoes on the web... till you actually try them out you really don't know for sure if it was a good choice. Just didn't suit me very well other than being wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Reknso

customer_reviews.title: Very good mouse. One small caveat
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse. Very configurable. Overall very happy with it. It loses a star for the inaccurate battery measurement. As posted on some forums, it'll get to one bar in no time. Complain that it will die soon. And then run for days of moderate to heavy use before actually dying. I HIGHLY suggest putting it in battery saver mode. It does not affect it's performance when actively being used but greatly increases battery life when you forget to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Solid gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: The responsiveness is realy great when wired or wireless. I did have performance issues when wireless with the sensitivity (reports per second) turned all the way up, but turning it down two notches gives fantastic performance and no further problems. The side grips took a little getting use to; they're a bit rough to the touch, but now I never notice it and there's no issues with grip ever. It never feels slick from prolonged play. Battery life is good, but not great. I can play for 6 hours at a charge. The wired cord acts as a charger and still feels good to play with while wired and charging.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: great mouse
customer_reviews.text: i been pc gaming for years and years and have been through many mice. this one is super comfy in the hand at a perfect angle. enough keys to play any game and use macros very fast. i use it it wireless mode and it never ever lags and the battery indicator helps you make sure you never run low durring pvp or a firefight...just keep the cord near, plug it in and you are in wired mode and charging. set point software is easy to use but boring..does its job though. this is a full sized mouse unlike many i have had that were on the smaller side so keep that in mind when picking one.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, not-so-great driver/software
customer_reviews.text: Very cool, very responsive mouse. I love the extra buttons and profile switching. The only gripe I have is with Logitech's software to run this thing. Every time my laptop goes into standby or hibernate, I have to restart the software to get the mouse working properly. I ended up writing a batch file to do it, so it's no more than a minor inconvenience, but for the price, there should be no inconveniences at all. Wish Logitech would fix their garbage software, then this mouse would be worth five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ajha100

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: The gaming mouse was by far the best I had ever bought. I use it every day, often transporting it in my backpack. It has not failed to work even under heavy use. The setup for customising buttons was easy and simple. I would prefer this mouse to the even more expensive models that are out there. This is by far my favorite wireless solution.
customer_reviews.author: TheRealNicl

customer_reviews.title: I love logitech and have never had any problems with their ...
customer_reviews.text: I love logitech and have never had any problems with their stuff so I wasn't worried about ordering this mouse to try and I don't regret my decision. I forget how long I've had it but it's been already 3 years possibly more and it still works like new and keeps it's charge like when I first bought it. Logitech still hasn't let me down ♡
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse and use all the buttons on it every day for Warcraft. The fact that WoW doesn't recognize all the buttons as, well, buttons is a pain - but it's like that for all mice besides the World of Warcraft branded ones. My solution was making the buttons be unused keys ([, ], etc). The different profiles makes that not be an issue outside of the game as well, since I can tell it to only load my Warcraft profile when wow.exe is launched. This way I can have the buttons do different things for different programs automatically!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Glonek

customer_reviews.title: Wanted a new gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: Been gaming for years not using a gaming mouse, love logitech products so tried this mouse out. Simply love it, its comfortable and the adjustments i can make for sensitivity on the fly is awesome. Update after having this mouse for a few months, the G10 button is stuck and Logitech will not warranty anything through a third party vendor like Hyper Tech, it has to be an approved vendor like Amazon LLC... Again if you want your 3 year warranty DO NOT BUY FROM HYPER TECH, logitech will not validate your Warranty and my mouse is only a few months old!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse, HORRIBLE battery life
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a customisable mouse to use while editing images in PS CS5 and also while gaming. I had used the Logitech M705 in the past, which has an AMAZING battery life and had only hoped this one would last half as long. Try 1/50th ! I can not go through a single day of work without plugging this mouse in by noon. It is very annoying to have paid this much and ended up with a corded mouse 80% of the time. Other than battery life, this is a great mouse that's full of features and comfortable to use (except when corded)
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Is it worth the money? Yes
customer_reviews.text: Wireless mice are a dime a dozen right now, but this one is truly a rose among thorns. There is nothing worse than having your mouse act up/die while in the middle of a firefight, and so far I have had no problems with this one. It includes a rechargable battery, and rather than forceing you to put it on a dock to charge, you plug it in with a usb and keep playing/working. Also ive tried other mice from Logitech and Microsoft and have always had a problem with wireless interference from my router. Not a problem with this one so far. Ther is also a really nice texture on the grip portion of the mouse. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Alan Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is
customer_reviews.text: it's a gaming mouse, with lots of customizable buttons. the positions of the button's don't quite match up with my hands but that's not the manufacturer's fault. It does not however use the logitech unifying receiver, which I was quote disappointed with. I was hoping to use one receiver for the mouse and the keyboard. overall, it's good, mouse control is good, it's adjustable, buttons are useful. texture takes bit of getting used to, and click noise every time you click gets bit annoying to me.
customer_reviews.author: NewUser

customer_reviews.title: Right mouse button requires more force...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't checked out all the features yet, but my initial impression is that the one I received is either defective or poorly designed. The right mouse button requires considerable more pressure to get it to click than the left button. At first I didn't even think it worked. Returned to Amazon with their prepaid label, received a new one in 2 days, and works perfectly! One quirk with the Setpoint software is the version numbers used. When you download/install version 6 (6.32 currently), the version that is installed for the Gaming mouse is version 5 (5.46.10).
customer_reviews.author: Me In Scottsdale AZ

customer_reviews.title: "upgrade" from revolution mx
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for about a week, going from a mx revolution. I had to replace the mx due to left mouse button switch going bad. I'm hoping the same doesn't happen with this one. Seems to last a full work day of HEAVY cad use and charges overnight. I love that it uses eneloops, I've got tons of these already. As for the mouse. Having 13 programmable buttons is really nice, they are all quite reachable except the 2 behind middle mouse button. I haven't noticed any performance differences between wired and wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Dehaan

customer_reviews.title: I loved this mouse but after a while
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mouse but after a while... over a year ... i was beginning to have disconnect issues with the wired usb. also the left click went out after a year of playing daily games. It is still useable but if i hit the left click to hard it will unclick and reclick making continuous mouse 1 holding annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent gaming mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my Microsoft Sidewinder X8. I was really happy with that mouse and I was a bit hesitant to shift brands but I really didn't have much choice since Microsoft discontinued Sidewinder mice. However, I don't have a single complaint about this mouse. It really is pretty good. It's fairly light and there is no noticeable lag with it being a wireless mouse. I can also play through an entire day of FPS gaming on my PC and still have battery life left over. I definitely recommend this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect except for battery life
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is only a day or two with heavy use (gaming), a week with moderate use. The upside is that you can charge with the cord, but I don't recommend for gaming while charging. Lots of programmable buttons and easy to switch profiles on the fly. The feel is just gritty and matte enough to feel grippy and comfortable. The shape is ergonomic and functional. It's not shaped for looks first. Great mouse, but have rechargeable batteries ready if playing a gaming session. It comes with a Sanyo eneloop battery, bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Drawring Simon

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this mouse because my girlfriend already got me the mouse. The return process was really fast good customer service. The mouse is awesome for FPS like BF3 really helped my performance. I noticed I knife alot more know that I use the one of the side buttons to knife. The Logitech software is decent not as bad as other software I seen from other companies. I love the fact that I can use a USB cable when I do not need it to be wireless and it will also charge it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Plasencia

customer_reviews.title: VERY good Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works very well. I was able to easily install and program it. My only issue is the button locations. I have what I assume is a normal handspan (7.5 inches from tip of middle finger to first crease in wrist. The most forward index finger button on the top of the mouse is a little far away and when I adjust my hand for that button, the lowest middle button is hard to reach and the lowest thumb button gets pushed. The result is I tend to only use one of these two but the control and feel are otherwise outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: I always found the Naga mouse to be too complicated with so many buttons. This mouse is easy to setup and has a bunch of buttons in easy to reach places for my small hands. The only downfall is that it is a bit heavy. Make sure you have enough space on your desk to rest your arm or else you'll quickly develop tennis elbow. I've had this mouse for about 2 years now. It has never failed me, and is customizable for each and every game that I play.
customer_reviews.author: Fraggle

customer_reviews.title: excellent gaming mouse
customer_reviews.text: I tried out numerous wireless gaming mouses from Bestbuy. This was one of the first, and it felt a littly bulky/heavy when I first tried it. So I returned it and tried four others. I ended up coming back to it for the build quality, the customization of all the buttons, and actually the weight. I ended up really liking the weight and size of it, I just wasn't used to it. The battery doesn't last very long when you are gaming, but a better rechargable AA is pretty cheap. Buy it, you will like it.
customer_reviews.author: ToThePoint

customer_reviews.title: Just awsome
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for awhile now and I actually like this one better than my previous mouse, which still works just fine, that cost $30 more. The wire/less set up is very handy and the warning pop up in the software is nice as well. There is a lot of tweekability with this one in the software for all the buttons and is definitely a gamers mouse. Although if you were very deep into photoshop editing etc. I am sure a profile could be configured that way as well.
customer_reviews.author: D M

customer_reviews.title: Best...Mouse...Ever...
customer_reviews.text: Love this because I am a gamer but my wife also uses the computer and it doesn't look ridiculous like some other gaming mouses. It is ergonomic, programmable, I like how the mouse clicks and buttons respond to my hand, it has good grip but not rubbery and it is Logitech so it is very sturdy (have dropped mine many times). Make sure you get a good rechargeable battery because it does eat batteries if you don't turn it off. Overall, best mouse I have tried out.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shape and button layout for me
customer_reviews.text: Perfect shape and button layout for me, found it to be there most comfortable mouse out therefor my grip. A little on the heavy side. Battery lasts a few hours at best, ended up using it wired more than I wanted. Eventually developed the double click issue in the left mouse button after a few years of use. Replaced with the g602.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Feibusch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent except a single land mine
customer_reviews.text: Good hand feel, lasts a long time (have had it for nearly a year of LoL/HotS use and still going strong). Only thing I'm not a fan of is the scroll-wheel mode selector and sensitivity selector being where your middle finger's knuckle will rest if you're using the scroll wheel as mouse button 3: if you accidentally hit it, either the mouse wheel turns to jelly and stops being useful, or the mouse's sensitivity goes haywire, either of which are problematic for twitch gaming.
customer_reviews.author: PuppetSoul

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, but too large for woman's hand
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for a few months and find that it's a little too large for me to maneuver comfortably for long periods, which can be problematic when raiding for several hours. I also have a relatively small space allocated for the mouse on my keyboard tray, and often run out of real estate when moving the mouse, banging it into the edges of the tray. The software is easy to use and the functionality of the mouse is good. I just wish it were sized better for me.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: i use this primarily as a wireless mouse for everyday use. at time of purchase these were going for twice the price. this thing works wonderfully and as i mentoned at time of purchase i could have got a "cheepy" mouse for same price, but ended up with a high quality gaming mouse cheeeply, that can be programed. fast shipping it all works great, plugged in or wifi gets great response and was $100 cheeper than a rat mouse with same dpi, and loads better dpi than the "cheepy". one could buy is same price range.
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: excellent mouse
customer_reviews.text: this is quite large, so to some people it may not feel quite right. for me, this is perfectly ergonomic, and the button layout makes it very easy to use the 4 side buttons by simply twitching my thumb. something fun for me was that is has 2 scroll modes switchable by the button behind the wheel, and the smooth scroll is a lot of fun for long distance scrolling or just screwing around
customer_reviews.author: Josephdalepi

customer_reviews.title: 2nd best mouse I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I have a preference for Logitech peripherals which has been fostered through my very positiv experiences with their products and their excellent customer service. That said some products meet expectations and others exceed them. This one is the latter. Many customizable buttons, scroll switching mode on the wheel and excellent response. My favorite mouse ever was the Logitech MX Revolution. Their replacement for it is inferior. I would use this one instead (and I do).
customer_reviews.author: ALLUSA

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse and I'm not a gamer!!
customer_reviews.text: It's just a great mouse!! I'm not a gamer but I program all the buttons for several routine functions (pg up/down, Enter, delete, etc). One thing I really like is the multiple profiles. I use one for Lightroom and it's great. I tried a tablet/pen setup but it's just too much moving around. The buttons/profiles on this mouse is the perfect solution to go from office work, to web surfing, to photo editing. It really should get a 5+!!!
customer_reviews.author: RAHAlphaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse after having trouble with response time in other wireless mice. I think that is what I'm most happy with is the ability to have more control in setting the the sensitivity and then all the macro's you can set with the other buttons. the only down side is the battery does have to be charged a few times a week, but that is with heavy use. The mouse does charge quick though and honestly, I have a micro USB charger that came with my Bluetooth headset and I use it to charge the mouse in less than 2 hours. Overall though, it's a great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Logitech G700
customer_reviews.text: Received this mouse yesterday. Fits great with the natural contour of my palm. The feet glides nice and smoothly along the surface of my desk. The G buttons located next to your thumb and dpi + / - buttons have different "generic" functions depending on your operating system. There is no software disc so you do have to download the SetPoint software from the web. I would of given this gaming mouse 5 stars , but lacked the custom weights i enjoyed with the previous logitech gaming mice. This product comes with a extended usb cable specific for the receiver which was also a plus.
customer_reviews.author: willp.

customer_reviews.title: High performance!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is very powerful, sensitive and accurate, you put a bullet between the eyes of your enemies in combat and is very comfortable to work long hours in, I'm an architect and I make drawings and three-dimensional models and also game and throughout that this mouse behaves impeccably. Use one AA battery and recharges very nice with a cable that attaches to perfection like a fixed cable. I personally recommend this mouse because it is built solid with high quality materials, beautiful, fast, and very accurate. The best wireless mouse you've ever had or seen ....
customer_reviews.author: phuezoguzman

customer_reviews.title: Great for productivity or gaming
customer_reviews.text: On time delivery and Great product. I would recommend this mouse to any gamer or those wanting to improve their computer productivity through the use of a programmable mouse. Best, most ergonomic placement of multiple buttons I've used on a mouse. Love having multiple sensitivity settings. Wireless for me has been flawless although I've only tried from a short distance < 6' from the computer.
customer_reviews.author: EagleOnline

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse but the battery is weak.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse for use as a CAD mouse at work because I like the programmable buttons. This has a lot more buttons than I needed but I found functions for all of them! The software is easy to use and very flexible. The only con that I have found so far is the battery life. It won't even make an 8 hour shift before it's down to only one light on the indicator. Luckily, it's still usable while charging with the cable that basically makes it a corded mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Obie1

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse all around
customer_reviews.text: Good mouse all around, can reprogram the button to do what you want. Took two stars because this mouse is a pain the ass to clean, dirt gets stuck on the material on the side of the mouse and it just doesn't come off without some hardcore wiping, and even then it just spreads the dirt around. Then the dirt gets stuck in between the buttons and does it annoy me greatly.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse since G7
customer_reviews.text: Well I ordered this a couple days ago, but nothing came when UPS said its delivered. Thanks UPS for doing such a horrible job. Anyways, I didnt want to reorder and wait for them to lose my package again so I went to Bestbuy and got one. Easy plug n play, just download the program from logitech to configure your buttons. Got this as a replacement for the G7 since it kept disconnecting. Thanks Amazon for having such a good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostrecon720

customer_reviews.title: The best wireless gaming mouse in the planet.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse from Logitech because it come with a lot of features: wired and wireless option, different profile wich could be storage in, a bunch of buttons to map your favorite keys for better performance and access, free spin in the scroll wheel and switchable mode on the fly, laser sensor with a high DPI interface and quick response, switchable DPI on the fly for different kind of games, and etc, etc, etc. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Posadas

customer_reviews.title: Secondary.
customer_reviews.text: I already own a G700 mouse and I love it (Not nearly as good as the G500; However, I'd sacrifice it for being able to use a wireless gaming mouse, since my desk is slightly awkward and most mice don't have a long enough chord). Anyway, I bought this as a Secondary mouse for when my original G700 dies. The battery life is about 12 hours of constant use and because I work on the computer and computers in general, I tend to use my mouse a lot, so I bought this second one as a back-up.
customer_reviews.author: Ehpik

customer_reviews.title: Solid Gaming Mouse
customer_reviews.text: The grip on the mouse is very nice for my hand. It is very reactive for a wireless mouse and I have enjoyed every single feature about it except for one. The battery life on the mouse is very meh. Not overly impressive. I've had it running during a few league of legend matches and have to scurry to find the connector for the mouse. The good thing is the connector is tight fit to the mouse and does not shake loose or anything. If you can get the mouse on sale I would suggest you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C.

customer_reviews.title: OK mouse
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically the mouse is fine, although the buttons are very small and close to each other--I sometimes press two at the same time. My biggest issue with the mouse is that it has only one rechargeable battery, so I often have to have it plugged in at the same time as I am using it. This makes the mouse more difficult to use. Suggest Logitech put two batteries in the unit and it would be much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Could not be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I've always had my reservations about using a wireless mouse when it comes to gaming just because they rely on a short lived battery power supply, but I'm actually impressed with the customizability of the reports for the mouse making the battery actually last longer. There's also a really nifty cord which it comes with that allows you to charge the battery at the same time while your using it! Could not be happier with the mouse for that reason alone!
customer_reviews.author: D. Glackin

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, awful wireless
customer_reviews.text: I really, really like the hand-feel of this mouse. It fits my hand like a glove. My only complaints are that when you use the mouse wirelessly, it has a tendency to jump around and miss clicks. This still occurs after installing the newest software and updating the polling frequency to max. Also, I think the mouse could stand to be heavier, but that's more of a personal thing.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far!
customer_reviews.text: I use my mouse primarily for AutoCAD and this definitely fits the bill. Nice user interface and plenty of options. Easy setup. One minor comment would be the 2 scroll settings. One is unrestricted and allows the mouse to scroll continuosly on one spin. The other (which would be my complaint) feels really wierd. It feels a little bumpy when you scroll. Hard to describe but could have been a little smoother. It's designed to prevent continuos free scrolling but feels too mechanical.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm65

customer_reviews.title: Has held up well
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mouse for more than a year and it's held up well. I rarely use the wireless feature (my ASUS G73SW stays mainly on my desk), but it worked well on the occasions I have used it. The buttons are easy to program and I find their number to be adequate for most games that I play. I have largish hands and find the mouse more comfortable to use than the MS Ergonomic mouse it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Geek

customer_reviews.title: Superb Mouse for both Gaming, and Casual use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse. I've had it for a few years now, and it holds up great. I used to play PC games, and it was fun trolling people online in Call of Duty by making a rapid fire macro. And Diablo 3 was fun with all the preset buttons for various special moves, potions, etc. Now that i dont play video games, Web browsing is super fast with the free scroll toggle. If i want to get to the top of a page super fast, i just toggle the free scroll button, and flick the scroll wheel up. This is a great product. I am always satisfied with Logitech products.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Chebeleu

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life, basically a wired mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Why create a wireless mouse that can't hold a charge more than a couple days... Its a great mouse, but with that terrible battery life this mouse quickly became a wired mouse that took 2 usb ports. I can't recommend as their are better wired mice. I owned this mouse for 2 years. Why don't they make good mice that have bigger batteries or accept 2 AAs...?
customer_reviews.author: Toodles Magoo

product_meta.title: ULTIMATE Logitech Wireless Gaming Mouse G700 - 910-001436
product_meta.description:
Powerful control that gets you deep into your game. Wireless freedom without performance compromises. The G700 Logitech Wireless Gaming Mouse has 13 programmable controls, a natural shape that fits your hand, and full-speed wireless for freedom without performance compromises. No matter what your game, you'll have the control you need to get deep into it.

Key Features:

 * Control you can feel
   You’ve got 13 precisely placed, programmable controls to perform single actions and complex macros.
 * Comfort is king
   With natural curves that support your hand you can play comfortably and maneuver effortlessly for as long as you want.
 * Total freedom
   There’s nothing to slow you down with full-speed, gaming-grade wireless and a quick-connect charging cable.
